data.title: Wise (Robert) papers
data.text:
Script material (first draft, replaced by material dated July 2, 1969 undated

Manuscript (original) from Parachute jump in North Africa to VE Day in London undated

Notes and references used for Battle (through Spain) undated

Out pages and rewrites as of December 23, 1954 revision 1959-11-24-1959-12-20

[Research] Interviews (and people to be interviewed) 1959-05-1959-06

[Research] La Lucha Del Pueblo Espanol por su Libertad (The Spanish People's Fight for Liberty compiled by A. Ramos Oliveira) 1937

[Research] Report on Israel by Irwin Shaw and Robert Capa (includes letter to Robert Wise) 1950, 1960

[Research] A Russian Journal by John Steinbeck (with pictures by Robert Capa) 1948

[Script sections] first section, first revision: opening to Spain 1959-01-29

Text and captions - "Israel" and "The Religion and the Jew" undated

Text and captions - The Road to Jerusalem and Jerusalem story undated

Somebody Up There Likes Me

[Songs] "I Have Confidence in Me" (Maria) [sheet music and lyrics] 1964-02-17

[DoubleDay checks, made payable to Gertrude Lawrence, on matte frame (4)] 1944-11-01-1945-09-25

Sheet music: ["Star!" and The King and I] 1951, 1968

Songs: "Has Anybody Seen Our Ship" undated

Songs: "Have You Seen the Ducks?" undated

Songs: "If You Were the Only Girl in the World" undated

Songs: "It Ain't All Honey and it Ain't All Jam" undated

Songs: "Oh, I Must Go Home Tonight" undated

Songs: "Oh! Oh! Oh! It's a Lovely War" undated

Songs: "On the Sunny Side of the Street" (International Revue) undated

Songs: "Down at the Old Bull and Bush" undated

Songs: "Someday I'll Find You" from Private Lives undated

Songs: "Someone to Watch Over Me" (Oh Kay) undated

Songs: "You Were Meant For Me" undated

This Could Be the Night

[Casting reads (three 7 1/2" magnetic tape reels)] undated

Music [includes 7 1/2" magnetic tape of "Bronx Lullaby"] 1962-01-04-1962-05-24

Two for the Seesaw: a comedy-drama in three acts by William Gibson 1960

Casting interviews (Hollywood and New York) [photos and 7 1/2" magnetic tape] 1960

Musical score by Leonard Bernstein, lyrics by Stephen Sondheim, Vols. I and II 1961-03-29-1961-05-17

"And the day star arise in your hearts" [crystal paperweight] undated

SBI Owl Award for Domestic Movie of the Year: West Side Story 1961

Diosas de Plata [Silver Goddesses award from the Cinematographic Journalists of Mexico, base separate from top] 1963

Diosas de Plata [Silver Goddesses award from the Cinematographic Journalists of Mexico] 1964

American Cinema Editors - Best Director and Best Motion Picture: The Sound of Music [two awards, tops separate from bases] 1965

American Cinema Editors Special Award: Outstanding Filmmaking Achievements in Climaxing Career which began in Editing [top separate from base] 1967-04

Motion Picture Costumers Filmmaker of the Year 1967-10-28

Photoplay Award: Best film, Best Actress - The Sound of Music [two items] 1968

[Playbills: The Sound of Music and Oh What a Lovely War] undated

Capital and other writings by Karl Marx [book] 1932

To the One I Love the Best by Ludwig Bemelmans [book] 1955

The Mediterranean by Jasper More [book] 1956

Cinefantastique. Vol 6, No. 1, 4. Vol. 7, No. 1 1977

The Curse of the Cat People 1943

The Day the Earth Stood Still 1951

I Want to Live! 1958

Somebody Up There Likes Me 1956

Somebody Up There Likes Me (re-writes and notes) 1956

The Sound of Music [not leather bound, photocopied final draft, pages missing] 1964-01-07

This Could Be the Night 1957
